displaytitle: Caricature of a standing fat man in a cap, facing left
medium: Pen and brown ink, brown wash on cream laid paper
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895

titles.title: Caricature of a standing fat man in a cap, facing left

makers.displaydate: 1696–1770; born Venice, Italy; died Madrid, Spain
makers.displaymaker: Giovanni Battista Tiepolo, 1696–1770; born Venice, Italy; died Madrid, Spain

texts.textentryhtml: <?xml:namespace prefix = "o" ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p>This pen and wash drawing by the Venetian artist Giovanni Battista Tiepolo shows the well-established tradition of choosing a profile view for a caricature in order to maximize the exaggeration of a figure’s features and dimensions. In this drawing, the figure’s curved nose complements his robust midsection revealed by his stance and tugging robe. Tiepolo’s careful application of wash to create subtle lighting effects is evident on the figures’ bodies and in their cast shadows.</o:p>
texts.remarks: K2 Corridor Going to Extremes: Physiognomy, Caricature, and Studies of Expression
